description:
The Three Musketeers: The year is 1625. The young D'Artagnan arrives in Paris at the tender age of 18, and almost immediately offends three musketeers, Porthos, Aramis, and Athos. Instead of dueling, the four are attacked by five of the Cardinal's guards, and the courage of the youth is made apparent during the battle. The four become fast friends and embark upon an adventure that takes them across both France and England in order to thwart the plans of the Cardinal Richelieu. Along the way, they encounter a beautiful young spy, named simply Milady, who will stop at nothing to disgrace Queen Anne of Austria before her husband, Louis XIII, and take her revenge upon the four friends.

(Source: AniDB)

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).

French writer, best known for his numerous historical novels of high adventure which have made him one of the most widely read French authors in the world. Many of his novels, including The Count of Monte Cristo, The Three Musketeers, Twenty Years After, and The Vicomte de Bragelonne were serialized. He also wrote plays and magazine articles and was a prolific correspondent.

[Website](http://norikosakai.co.jp/)

Noriko Sakai is a Japanese singer and actress. Under her former stage name Nori-P, Sakai released her first single, "Otoko no Ko ni Naritai" on February 5, 1987, nine days short of her sixteenth birthday. Over 40,000 copies of the single were sold. She is particularly popular in Hong Kong and Taiwan. Her best-selling single to date is "Aoi Usagi".

In August 2009, Sakai was arrested on suspicion of possession and abuse of drugs and sentenced to probation for three years. She divorced her husband Yūichi Takasō after the incident and temporarily stayed away from the media circle. After her probation ended, she began rehearsals for the theater, and signed on with Office Nigun Niiba, as a first step towards returning to the media community. On May 1, 2021, she left Office Nigun Niiba and joined Smile.
French singer mainly known for his work with French theme songs.

Monkey Punch is the pen name of mangaka Kazuhiko Katou, creator of the successful Japanese manga series [Lupin III](https://anilist.co/manga/30438/), which is still being animated to this day.

Influenced by [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s works, he began to draw and moved to Tokyo in 1957 after graduating from high school. From 1959, he wrote for a publishing company specializing in rental books under the pen name "Kazuhiko Katou," while working on doujins with his younger brother, Teruhiko Katou, and another friend. After moving to Tokyo, he was influenced by the American parody magazine "MAD," and his style changed to an American comic book style. This caught the attention of Fumito Shimizu, editor-in-chief of Futabasha, and in 1966 he made his full-fledged debut with Playboy Nyuumon under the pen name Eiji Muta. Under the name of "Mania Group," it was made to look as if Senji Mashuu (摩周仙二) and Eiji Kirita (霧多永二) were participating, but in reality, Katou wrote the whole story by himself.

In 1966, under the orders of editor-in-chief Shimizu, he changed his pen name to Monkey Punch. Katou didn't like the name because it was given to a newcomer at random, and he planned to change it after about a year, but he couldn't change it because the work he published under this name the following year became a big hit.

In May 1967, he was selected to draw the cover art for "Zengan Manga Story Action Tokushuu-gou," which was published mainly for newcomers to "Manga Story," such as Baron Yoshimoto and Ken Tsukikage, and he continued to draw the cover art for "Shuukan Manga Action," a weekly seinen manga magazine that was newly launched in August with Shimizu as editor-in-chief. He also began serializing Lupin III under the title with the notation "Original by [Leblanc](https://anilist.co/staff/122907/)." in the August 10 first issue of Manga Action.

In addition to Lupin III, he has also created works such as Fukushuu Daikou, [Cinderella Boy](https://anilist.co/manga/71117/), and [MUSASHI: Gundou](https://anilist.co/anime/1200/). In 1996, he took on the challenge of directing an animated film with [Lupin III: Dead or Alive](https://anilist.co/anime/1416/).

He passed away due to pneumonia on April 11, 2019.

**Awards:**
- Inkpot Award
- Rome Comic Festival ROMICS Gold Award
- AMD Award for Merit
- Japan Cartoonists Association Award Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology Award

(Source: Wikipedia)

Shuuichi Kakesu was born 1957 in Chiba Prefecture, Japan. He is a graduate student of Japan Academy of Moving Images and the founder and current representative director of editing studio Jay Film.

He started working at editing studio Okayasu Promotion, where he studied under Okayasu Hajime himself. In 1990 he founded Jay Film; or reorganised Kakesu Henshuushitsu, an editing studio he founded previously, into Jay Film. He was the first to introduce the non-linear editing system in Japan in 1994.

Kakesu won an Association of Media in Digital Award in 1996.
Kyousuke Mikuriya is a director and storyboard artist.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/193376/)._

[Blog](http://aminon.asablo.jp/blog/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%A2%E3%83%9F%E3%83%8E%E3%83%86%E3%83%84%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tetsur%C5%8D_Amino)

Tetsurou Amino is a Japanese director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

In 1988, he started using his name in katakana.
Kyousuke Mikuriya is a director and storyboard artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山内昇寿郎)

Passed away due to a cerebral infarction on August 24, 2010.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/進藤満尾)

Former representative director of Shindou Production.

Yasuo Tanami was a scriptwriter.

He graduated from Keio University.
